title: UofL assistant coach Ralph Willard to take medical leave
text:
UofL assistant coach Ralph Willard to take medical leave UPDATED 3:32 PM EDT Oct 12, 2015 Photos 
Ralph Willard 
University of Louisville men's basketball assistant coach Ralph Willard will take a medical leave of absence to address a medical condition. More 
Willard rejoined the Cardinals earlier this year after having previously served as an assistant under Rick Pitino for the NBA New York Knicks (1987-1989), at the University of Kentucky (1989-1990) and at UofL (2009-2010) and as director of basketball operations (2010-2011). 
"I'm very disappointed that this has happened," said Willard. "I'm confident that I'm getting the best medical advice to alleviate or correct this situation." 
"Ralph is one of the game's great teachers and one of my closest friends in life," said Pitino. "My only concern right now is that he gets healthy and has a speedy recovery from some problems that need immediate attention. " 
Willard was also head coach at Western Kentucky University, the University of Pittsburgh and Holy Cross. 
Former Card and current Director of Basketball Operations David Padgett will move into the assistant coaching position in Willard's absence while still managing his other role.
